definition: smell of alcohol/flavoring of rum or other liquor in food/aroma or nose (of wine)
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: The wine is elegant with persistent velvety tannins.
sentences.chinese: 酒味典雅，含有柔和的丹宁酸。

sentences.english: The produced liquor has strong aroma and belongs to health wine.
sentences.chinese: 所生产白酒酒味浓香，属于保健酒。

sentences.english: Are extremely delicate flavor and alcohol, the finish can last one hour.
sentences.chinese: 香味和酒味都极端细致，余味能持续一个小时上。

sentences.english: Enters smoothly, body unfolding all the way to the end of the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 口感滑顺，在入吼时酒味伸展演变。

sentences.english: Thearoma is delivered straight to your taste buds inside the bubbles.
sentences.chinese: 这样一来，酒味的芳香可以通过汽泡直达你的味蕾。

sentences.english: But occasionally he'd smelled wine on her breath.
sentences.chinese: 但偶尔，他从她的气息中闻到酒味。

sentences.english: The smell of the spilt wine reminded him of the accident.
sentences.chinese: 倒洒的酒味让他想起了那件事。

sentences.english: Police say this man may have been trying to cover the alcohol on his breath by drinking Wite-Out .
sentences.chinese: 警方称此人可能曾喝修正液来掩盖其酒味。

sentences.english: You must have drunk somewhere. Your breath smells of wine.
sentences.chinese: 你肯定在哪里喝过酒，你呼出的有酒味。

definition: to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
to dissipate the effects of alcohol/to sober up
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
